attributes.action: Prioritise vaccines for all workers who cannot stay home
attributes.additional_details: This is a matter of social justice, as well as of social and political imagination. Covid is disproportionally killing the poorest, alongside some also in more celebrated frontline professions. Any decently thoughtful mixed approach will be more socially just than simply takingn account of asocial individual vulnerability.
attributes.background: Prioritise covid vaccines not simply on the basis of asocial individual medical vulnerability, but also offer it as a priority to all who cannot stay safely at home -- e.g. bus drivers, teachers, medical and care workers, supermarket workers etc..
